output.name: Raccoon
output.description: A Grasshopper plugin for CNC fabrication enabling drilling, milling, cutting, slicing, engraving and saw-blade fabrication with 5-axis machines and industrial robot arms, including collision detection and tool-path simulation.

entity.title: Robotic Timber Construction
entity.publication_type: text::conference output::conference poster not in proceedings

academicCatalogRelations.justification: Retrieved from publications by Petras Vestartas using get_author_publications_tool.

entity.title: Laser Scanning with Industrial Robot Arm for Raw-wood Fabrication
entity.abstract: This paper presents an integrated raw-wood fabrication workflow using an industrial robot arm and a laser scanner. The research is situated in a Swiss mountain forestry context where timber in its natural form could be applied locally without relying on large centralized timber industries.

academicCatalogRelations.justification: Retrieved from publications by Petras Vestartas using get_author_publications_tool.

entity.title: Design-to-Fabrication Workflow for Raw-Sawn-Timber using Joinery Solver
entity.abstract: Currently, the Swiss timber industry in mountain areas largely exports unprocessed lumber and imports finished timber products due to the lack of digital tools. By using new digital design-to-production workflows, it is possible to investigate new building systems for small-scale structures using local resources.

academicCatalogRelations.justification: Retrieved from publications by Petras Vestartas using get_author_publications_tool.

entity.title: Joinery Solver for Whole Timber Structures
entity.abstract: This paper presents a digital joinery generation method for whole-timber structures using wood-wood connections. The research is based on a collaboration with a local timber company located in a mountain area.
entity.publication_type: text::conference output::conference paper not in proceedings

academicCatalogRelations.justification: Retrieved from publications by Petras Vestartas using get_author_publications_tool.

entity.title: Structural design methodology in Integrally-Attached Timber Plate structures
entity.abstract: The immediate application of research discoveries requires a global and exact understanding of the structure under consideration. To gain insight into the complex behavior of structures, numerical simulations are carried out in parallel to physical experiments and digital fabrication, computer-aided processes.

academicCatalogRelations.justification: Retrieved from publications by Petras Vestartas using get_author_publications_tool.

entity.title: Parametric Workshop
entity.abstract: This bi-annual workshop is an introduction to parametric design for Master 1 students following Studio Weinand. Topics include the impact of digital technologies on the design process, fabrication and assembly constraints, collaborative workflows, geometry fundamentals, and constructive algorithms.

academicCatalogRelations.justification: Retrieved from publications by Petras Vestartas using get_author_publications_tool.

entity.title: Robotically-Fabricated Nexorades from Whole Timber
entity.abstract: This paper introduces the conceptual design of sustainable timber structures using raw wood. It presents a workflow for systematically generating Nexorades using a tiling method for multi-valence quad subdivided surfaces, based on an integrated framework combining resource-efficient fabrication strategies.
entity.publication_type: text::conference output::conference paper not in proceedings

academicCatalogRelations.justification: Retrieved from publications by Petras Vestartas using get_author_publications_tool.

entity.title: Design framework for the structural analysis of free-form timber plate structures using wood-wood connections
entity.abstract: Geometrically complex timber plate structures using wood-wood connections are increasingly designed thanks to digital fabrication. Whereas their fabrication has been automated using computer-aided design programming, research focused on the development of automated numerical tools for their structural analysis.

academicCatalogRelations.justification: Retrieved from publications by Petras Vestartas using get_author_publications_tool.

entity.title: Modelling Workflow for Segmented Timber Shells using Wood-wood Connections.
entity.abstract: This paper presents a modelling method based on planarization for double-curved segmented timber shell made from quad polygons and assembled by wood-wood connections, inspired by traditional timber dome construction techniques.

academicCatalogRelations.justification: Retrieved from publications by Petras Vestartas using get_author_publications_tool.

entity.title: Performance Assessment of Double-Layered Timber Plate Shells using Alternative Structural Systems
entity.abstract: With recent advances in digital fabrication, innovative wood-wood connections inspired by ancient timber joining techniques have recently been applied to various free-form timber plate structures. This paper focuses on the recently developed double-layered and double-curved timber plate shells.

academicCatalogRelations.justification: Retrieved from publications by Petras Vestartas using get_author_publications_tool.

disciplineJustification: Tool-path generation and CNC fabrication rely on mechanical engineering principles.
